alert.note: Alert for Coahoma; DeSoto; Panola; Quitman; Tate; Tunica (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 01 at 8:46PM CST by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lee, southeastern DeSoto, northeastern Coahoma, Tunica, Tate, northeastern Quitman and northern Panola Counties through 930 PM CST... At 846 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over St Francis National Park, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Senatobia, John W Kyle State Park, Sardis, Coldwater, Como, Tunica, Crenshaw, Sledge, Strayhorn, Pleasant Grove, Dubbs, North Tunica, Dundee, Arkabutla, Barr, Phillipp, Independence, Little Texas, Lula and Askew. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for eastern Arkansas...and northwestern Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Coahoma; DeSoto; Panola; Quitman; Tate; Tunica
